intro: Ranunculus scaldianus, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers and palmate leaves that are typically divided into five to nine lobes. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many other showy and sometimes toxic plants. Ranunculus scaldianus is a perennial herb that blooms in spring and is valued for its ornamental beauty in garden settings.
